reviews.title: Warm and inviting
reviews.text: My husband and I needed a much deserved break. What a perfect,romantic place to go. The Inn is beautifully decorated and the location is walking distance to Old Downtown. Susie and Ken are naturals!!! I was treated as a guest with everyting I needed,yet I felt like family. I didn't want to leave!

reviews.title: home away from home
reviews.text: I just returned from a long weekend at Cedar Gables Inn.

reviews.title: A model for B&Bs
reviews.text: This is everything a B&B is supposed to be. It's not cheap, and because of that, I had very high expectations. To my pleasant surprise, they were more than met. As other reviews have said, husband/wife owners Ken and Susie are the perfect hosts. They really seem to love what they do, which adds to the enjoyment of staying here. Every evening, they host a happy hour in their downstairs pub, generously pouring local wines with accompanying appetizers and telling stories. It's like being invited to a party every day. We stayed there three nights celebrating our 11th wedding anniversary and got to know other guests and Ken and Susie, adding to the party feel. (By the way, we were suprised by a bottle of champagne waiting in our room with anniverary wishes.) Ken and Susie will do everything they can to help you and make your stay enjoyable. They even offer a tutorial about local vineyards, providing coupons and making recommendations. Our room was great. We were there during what was possibly the hottest week in Napa Valley history, and thankfully our room had two air conditioners. Breakfasts were lovely, coffee and tea were always available and there were dishes of chocolate candy everywhere. The home-baked chocolate-chip cookies left in the lobby throughout the day are to die for (I think the best I've ever had) and are reason enough to stay here! Thanks, Ken and Susie, for making our anniversary memorable, romantic and fun despite the uncomfortable weather!

Our weekend get-a-way to Napa was planned to be a very special anniversary celebration, so consequently we did some research to locate the perfect B&B and are so pleased we chose the magnificent Cedar Gables Inn!
reviews.title: This place is truly Napa Valley's most enjoyable B&B
We Loved It!
reviews.text: The location was perfect, just on the fringe of downtown Napa, in a safe neighborhood within walking distance to several great restaurants. Each morning we were greeted by a gourmet breakfast of home baked breads, fresh fruit, juices & coffee along with an outrageous special entrée that changed daily. We enjoyed Strawberry French Toast Soufflé served alongside the best apple sausage we’ve ever tasted on the first morning. This was not to be outdone by the second morning, a southwestern style strata made with tortillas, country sausage, fresh salsa and rich corn muffins.
Each evening we mingled with our gracious Innkeepers, Ken & Susie, along with the other guests in the old English style pub over a glass (or two) of wine and nibbles.
reviews.title: Great place - We didn't want to leave!

reviews.text: Susie arranged our restaurant reservations and Ken helped us plan our winery tour. Their recommendations were spot on, helping to ensure a perfect weekend. An unexpected bonus was all the complementary wine tastings we received when the winery staff would learn that Ken & Susie from Cedar Gables had sent us.
reviews.title: An elegant, romantic Inn
